result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephanie Michell Negron-Montalvo

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Stephanie Michell Negron-Montalvo appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening appeared by video for Stephanie Michell Negron-Montalvo.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sworn Spanish Interpreter: Natalia Fajardo.
Attorney Luening is new to the case and does not have discovery or an offer.  Case is adjourned to 11-10-22 at 8:30 am for status of counsel by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 093458,
Payable Number: 1036130,
Receipt Number: 22RP039509,
Amount: $20.00

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with EEC.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Stephanie Michell Negron-Montalvo in court.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sworn as Spanish Interpreter: Hilda Shymanik. Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date. The case is adjourned to Br. 10 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Stephanie Michell Negron-Montalvo in court. 
Case adjourned to September 26th, 1:00 PM in Out of Custody Court, Safety Building Room 221 for interpreter.
